title: Alex Padilla
added: Upon his appointment to the U.S. Senate, Governor Gavin Newsom appointed Assemblymwoman [[Shirley Weber]] to succeed him.

title: Alex Padilla
added: Upon his appointment to the U.S. Senate, Governor Gavin Newsom appointedAssemblywoman[[Shirley Weber]] to succeed him.

title: Alex Padilla
deleted: Opposition to Padilla's appointment was led by California Assemblyman and lawyer [[Kevin Kiley (politician)|Kevin Kiley]], who has said that a legal opinion he obtained from the Office of the Legislative Counsel holds that the appointment is unconstitutional under the [[Seventeenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Seventeenth Amendment]] of the [[United States Constitution|Constitution]], which "requires the Governor to issue a writ of election" to fill the vacancy and that Padilla may thus not be seated as a senator without a statewide election.<ref>https://blog.electkevinkiley.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/2100271-1.pdf</ref> However, the Anendment also says: "the legislature of any State may empower the executive thereof to make temporary appointments until the people fill the vacancies by election..."

title: Alex Padilla
added: Padilla has indicated that he is [[Abortion-rights movements|pro-choice]], stating in 2018 that women's right to abort "is not negotiable.".<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=|title=Alex Padilla on Twitter: A woman’s right to choose what happens to her own body is not negotiable. #NoAbortionBan|url=https://twitter.com/AlexPadilla4CA/status/957759195901845509?s=20|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=[[Twitter]]|publication-date=2018-01-28}}</ref> In 2018, after winning the primary for secretary of state to seek a second term, he received the support of the pro-abortion organization [[NARAL Pro-Choice America]], organization that called Padilla a "statewide reproductive freedom champion and looks forward to continuing the fight for women’s rights".<ref>{{Cite web|date=2018-06-06|title=NARAL Pro-Choice America Congratulates Endorsed Candidates in California on Primary Victories|url=https://www.prochoiceamerica.org/2018/06/06/naral-pro-choice-america-congratulates-endorsed-california-candidates-on-primary-victories/|access-date=2021-01-21|website=NARAL Pro-Choice America|language=en-US}}</ref> In 2008, Padilla sponsored the bill SB 1770, which would require the Commission on Peace Officer Standards Training (POST) to prepare relevant guidelines and mechanisms for the investigation and reporting of "cases involving anti-[[reproductive rights]] crimes".<ref>{{Cite web|last=Simmons|first=Christopher|date=2014-01-06|title=Calif. Senator Alex Padilla Highlights 2013 Legislative Accomplishments - Begins Final Year in State Senate|url=https://californianewswire.com/calif-senator-alex-padilla-highlights-2013-legislative-accomplishments-begins-final-year-state-senate/|access-date=2021-01-21|website=California Newswire|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Bill Text - SB-1770 Anti-reproductive-rights crime.|url=http://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billTextClient.xhtml?bill_id=200720080SB1770|access-date=2021-01-21|website=leginfo.legislature.ca.gov}}</ref>

Padilla has been a supporter of the immigrants' rights.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|date=2021-01-16|title=Padilla backs legislation to fast-track citizenship for undocumented essential workers|url=https://fox40.com/news/california-connection/padilla-backs-legislation-to-fast-track-citizenship-for-undocumented-essential-workers/|access-date=2021-01-21|website=FOX40|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":5">{{Cite web|last=EST|first=Adrian Carrasquillo On 1/19/21 at 5:35 PM|date=2021-01-19|title=Incoming Senator Alex Padilla looks to lead on immigration, targets Cruz, Hawley|url=https://www.newsweek.com/incoming-senator-alex-padilla-looks-lead-immigration-targets-cruz-hawley-1562729|access-date=2021-01-21|website=Newsweek|language=en}}</ref> Shortly before he was sworn in as a senator, on January 15, 2021, he stated that he supports legislation sponsored by representative [[Joaquin Castro]] (D-TX) that will speed up the citizenship process for [[Illegal immigration|illegal immigrants]] in essential jobs declaring that because of the work they do "they deserve stability."<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":5" />

title: Alex Padilla

title: Alex Padilla
added: Padilla has been know for efforts to expand voting access.<ref name="SFChronical">{{cite news |last1=Koseff |first1=Alexei |title=Who is Alex Padilla? California's new senator has broken ground in state politics for two decades |url=https://www.sfchronicle.com/politics/article/Who-is-Alex-Padilla-California-s-new-senator-15822135.php |access-date=19 February 2021 |publisher=San Francisco Chronicle |date=22 December 2020}}</ref>

title: Alex Padilla
added: Padilla has been know for efforts to expand voting access.<ref name="SFChronical">{{cite news |last1=Koseff |first1=Alexei |title=Who is Alex Padilla? California's new senator has broken ground in state politics for two decades |url=https://www.sfchronicle.com/politics/article/Who-is-Alex-Padilla-California-s-new-senator-15822135.php |access-date=19 February 2021 |publisher=San Francisco Chronicle|date=22 December 2020}}</ref> When he was appointed to the United States Senate in 2020, Governor Newsom called him "a national defender of voting rights."<ref>{{cite news |title=Alex Padilla Senate pick makes history but leaves California with $34 million bill |url=https://www.sacbee.com/opinion/editorials/article248032375.html |access-date=19 February 2021 |publisher=Sacramento Bee|date=22 December 2020}}</ref>
